intro: Tetrazygia angustiflora, commonly known as the narrow-flowered tetrazygia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed, and it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
